results.title: Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol.
results.text_hl: A randomized double-blind study lasting 2 months was performed with either 25 mg @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ twice a day or 50 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ once a day in 125 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with established @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@ (diastolic blood pressure greater than 95 mmHg) identified during a population screening programme of subjects aged less than 65 years.

citations.NLM: Fletcher AE, Bulpitt CJ, Hawkins CM, Havinga TK, ten Berge BS, May JF, Schuurman FH, van der Veur E, Wesseling H. Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol. J Hypertens. 1990 May;8(5):463-6. PMID: 2163421
citations.BibTeX: @article{2163421, title={Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol.}, author={Fletcher AE and Bulpitt CJ and Hawkins CM and Havinga TK and ten Berge BS and May JF and Schuurman FH and van der Veur E and Wesseling H}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={8}, number={5}, pages={463-6}}

results.title: Central sympatholytic therapy has anti-inflammatory properties in hypertensive postmenopausal women.
results.text_hl: We compared the effect of two sympatholytic antihypertensive drug treatments, the centrally acting @GENE_NISCH @GENE_11188 @@@imidazoline receptor-1@@@ agonist @CHEMICAL_moxonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C043482 @@@moxonidine@@@ and peripherally acting beta-blocking agent @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on sensitive @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ markers in @DISEASE_Overweight @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@ postmenopausal @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Pöyhönen-Alho MK, Manhem K, Katzman P, Kibarskis A, Antikainen RL, Erkkola RU, Tuomilehto JO, Ebeling PE, Kaaja RJ. Central sympatholytic therapy has anti-inflammatory properties in hypertensive postmenopausal women. J Hypertens. 2008 Dec;26(12):2445-9. PMID: 19008724
citations.BibTeX: @article{19008724, title={Central sympatholytic therapy has anti-inflammatory properties in hypertensive postmenopausal women.}, author={Pöyhönen-Alho MK and Manhem K and Katzman P and Kibarskis A and Antikainen RL and Erkkola RU and Tuomilehto JO and Ebeling PE and Kaaja RJ}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={26}, number={12}, pages={2445-9}}
